commit_message:
Cherry-pick 2af86b8f6f749bf7b42a2c04b48c9a2dc28a46c9

Switched from fixtures to mock to mock out starting RPC consumers

fixtures 2.0.0 broke us wildly, so instead of trying to make it work
with new fixtures, I better just switch the mock to... mock.

Closes-Bug: #1567295

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/base.py

Change-Id: I4462712c7fc903088137f38591688f480b4681bb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/85/303285/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_related_rand_names(prefixes, max_length=None): """Returns a list of the prefixes with the same random characters appended :param prefixes: A list of prefix strings :param max_length: The maximum length of each returned string :returns: A list with each prefix appended with the same random characters """ if max_length: length = max_length - max(len(p) for p in prefixes) if length <= 0: raise ValueError("'max_length' must be longer than all prefixes") else: length = 8 rndchrs = utils.get_random_string(length) return [p + rndchrs for p in prefixes] mock.patch( return_value=[]).start()

subject: Add tag column to vifs and bdm
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-06 04:08:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/353a2948e476e80804a09cf61562dd88da3586f0', 'message': 'vNIC tagging: virtual interface tags DB table

A cloud user boots a VM with two network interfaces. One is connected
to a private network, the other to the public Internet. There is
currently no direct way to tell which interface is which. This patch
series proposes an optional virtual network interface tag that is set
by the user at boot time and is exposed in the metadata.

This patch introduces the virtual_interface_tags database table and
associated objects and database API methods.

Partially implements: blueprint virt-device-role-tagging

Change-Id: Ic8be3de4e970116772f9b6ce01c55e26b829e6cb

'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2016-01-12 17:50:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/00d212c5002b55f985e56e1f89b05293be13e3b2', 'message': "Add tag column to virtual_interfaces table

This patch series adds the ability for a user to specify a tag to be
applied to a network interface or a disk when booting an instance.
This tag is then exposed through the metadata API. For example, a user
boots a VM with two network interfaces. One is connected to a private
network, the other to the public Internet. There is currently no
direct way to tell which interface is which. Specifying tags allows
the user to distinguish between the two interfaces.

This patch contains the database migration to add a 'tag' column to
the virtual_interfaces table.

Implements: blueprint virt-device-role-tagging

Change-Id: Ic8be3de4e970116772f9b6ce01c55e26b829e6cb
"}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2016-01-12 19:09:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/55fa1d2b1692256898d45a9fb65f86218bb96c15', 'message': "Add tag column to virtual_interfaces table

This tag is then exposed through the metadata API. For example, a user
boots a VM with two network interfaces. One is connected to a private
network, the other to the public Internet. There is currently no
direct way to tell which interface is which. Specifying tags allows
the user to distinguish between the two interfaces.

This patch contains the database migration to add a 'tag' column to

boots a VM with two network interfaces. One is connected to a private
network, the other to the public Internet. There is currently no
direct way to tell which interface is which. Specifying tags allows
the user to distinguish between the two interfaces.

This patch contains the database migration to add a 'tag' column to
the virtual_interfaces and block_device_mapping tables as well as the
corresponding change to the VirtualInterface and BlockDeviceMapping
objects.

Implements: blueprint virt-device-role-tagging

commit_message:
Add tag column to vifs and bdm

This patch series adds the ability for a user to specify a tag to be
applied to a network interface or a disk when booting an instance.
This tag is then exposed through the metadata API. For example, a user
boots a VM with two network interfaces. One is connected to a private
network, the other to the public Internet. There is currently no
direct way to tell which interface is which. Specifying tags allows
the user to distinguish between the two interfaces.

This patch contains the database migration to add a 'tag' column to
the virtual_interfaces and block_device_mapping tables as well as the
corresponding change to the VirtualInterface and BlockDeviceMapping
objects.

Implements: blueprint virt-device-role-tagging
Co-authored-by: Vladik Romanovsky <vromanso@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ic8be3de4e970116772f9b6ce01c55e26b829e6cb

commit_message:
Port from optparse to argparse

Why now?

* argparse was introduced in Python 3.2 and back-ported to Python 2.7.
  Until we dropped Python 2.6 support, we were stuck on optparse.

* keystoneauth.loading.cli provides register_argparse_arguments and
  load_from_argparse_arguments helper methods. Now that we're moving
  toward Keystone Session support, argparse seems required.

Closes-Bug: 1553030
Change-Id: I5139fb64a8631a3010680090fd04345f95c55c7b

subject: Replace SELECT FOR UPDATE with optimistic locking
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-21 18:41:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl/commit/0784a566dc14ac03259fb36ce0e9be2d8a55f858', 'message': 'Replace SELECT FOR UPDATE with optimistic locking

SELECT FOR UPDATE is not a reliable way of locking DB resources as it's
not supported by DB backends such as Galera DB.
This pessimistic locking mode was already abandoned by the Neutron
project a while ago, and shouldn't be relied on by the ODL driver.

Insted, an optimistic locking method is used where a versioning key will
be used to check if the data is stale or not. Since we're trying to mark
a journal row as 'processing' when locking it, this fits the optimistic
lock paradigm.
Hence, when a row is attempted to be marked as 'processing' the ORM will
check if the row is still valid or stale. In case of a stale row, we
will move on to the next row (or return None as before if no more
pending rows are available). The API of the "get oldest pending row" is
maintained, while gaining a locking method that works uniformly across
various DBMS.

Currently, this is the only place requiring this locking paradigm since
once the row is succesfully marked as 'processing' only the thread that
suceeded will go on to actually process it.
Other places, when encountered in the future, should be handled in a
similar manner.

Change-Id: I35d9179b7a50271ae5af98c67abe86c908968f9f
Signed-off-by: Mike Kolesnik <mkolesni@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Replace SELECT FOR UPDATE with optimistic locking

SELECT FOR UPDATE is not a reliable way of locking DB resources as
it's not supported by DB backends such as Galera DB.
This pessimistic locking mode was already abandoned by the Neutron
project a while ago, and shouldn't be relied on by the ODL driver.

Instead, an optimistic locking method is used where a versioning key
will be used to check if the data is stale or not. Since we're trying
to mark a journal row as 'processing' when locking it, this fits the
optimistic lock paradigm.
Hence, when a row is attempted to be marked as 'processing' the ORM
will check if the row is still valid or stale. In case of a stale row,
we will move on to the next row (or return None as before if no more
pending rows are available). The API of the "get oldest pending row"
is maintained, while gaining a locking method that works uniformly
across various DBMS.

Currently, this is the only place requiring this locking paradigm
since once the row is succesfully marked as 'processing' only the
thread that succeeded will go on to actually process it.
Other places, when encountered in the future, should be handled in a
similar manner.

Change-Id: I35d9179b7a50271ae5af98c67abe86c908968f9f
Signed-off-by: Mike Kolesnik <mkolesni@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix a bug of ServiceManager.list()

In the ServiceManager.list(), filters(marker/limit/sort_key/detail)
have been missed, so that these features will be of no effect
whether specified or not.

Change-Id: Ib057f0893cd7e4e428ad61e54184d487fa8e9ebf
Partial-Bug: #1559960

commit_message:
Fix a bug of ReplicationControllerManager.list()

In the ReplicationControllerManager.list(),
filters(marker/limit/sort_key/detail) have been missed,
so that these features will be of no effect whether specified or not.

Change-Id: Ia9bee30399e55049556733346a1dbd1e784a1c38
Partial-Bug: #1559960

commit_message:
Fix a bug of PodManager.list()

In the PodManager.list(), filters(marker/limit/sort_key/detail)
have been missed, so that these features will be of no effect
whether specified or not.

Change-Id: Iad5b3298773f3d465d16f452c2534643d8d01442
Partial-Bug: #1559960

deleted_lines: def _path(id=None, bay_ident=None): if id and bay_ident: return '/v1/pods/%s/?bay_ident=%s' % (id, bay_ident) elif bay_ident: return '/v1/pods/?bay_ident=%s' % (bay_ident) else: return '/v1/pods' return self._list(self._path(bay_ident=bay_ident), "pods") else: return self._list_pagination(self._path(bay_ident=bay_ident),

been supported by magnum, so this patch tries to add support
of them for pod-list.

commit_message:
Router namespace not created in controller

When creating a router with an external network attached
from the Create Router form a router namespace doesn't
get created on the controller.

By calling the correct APIs, the namespace get
created.

To check the namespace list run the below command
on controller node.
'sudo ip netns list'

Change-Id: I829c707353830ff808b6f6a0b29ccedeca588616
Closes-Bug: #1535707

commit_message:
Add tests for the ironic REST API

Test ironic using the REST API.

Tests currently implemented:
  - list chassis
  - list nodes
  - list drivers
  - create node
  - create port
  - validate node
  - update node
  - delete node

Change-Id: I0a8ede31d8d3baa3f120ecb3e85bb8ff16e011d4

commit_message:
Set smt off and cpu-mode to host-passthrough for ppc64 architectures

When deploying a ppc64el compute node, smt needs to be
turned off and cpu-mode needs to be set to host-passthrough
for nova/libvirt/kvm use.

Change-Id: I48bd8f9e42dbc5f7c626addaa2fdd1e3f8fdd97e

commit_message:
Add restrictions for DPDK option

* 'ovs' bond should have enabled DPDK option
* DPDK can not be enabled on linux bond

Change-Id: I5867fe1ed34a5e735bfbd1a050d8209c1102bfb4

Switched from fixtures to mock to mock out starting RPC consumers

fixtures 2.0.0 broke us wildly, so instead of trying to make it work
with new fixtures, I better just switch the mock to... mock.

Closes-Bug: #1567295

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/base.py

commit_message:
messaging: remove RequestContextSerializer

We don't pass any oslo.context object around anymore, we just pass dict
if we really need to send some context information  which we barely
need actually.

And remove oslo.context!

Change-Id: I17d15c043b5c7d508af9a43f50511817f9e81151
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/81/300381/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: _SERIALIZER = oslo_serializer.JsonPayloadSerializer()
deleted_lines: import oslo_context.contextclass RequestContextSerializer(oslo_messaging.Serializer): def __init__(self, base): self._base = base def serialize_entity(self, context, entity): if not self._base: return entity return self._base.serialize_entity(context, entity) def deserialize_entity(self, context, entity): if not self._base: return entity return self._base.deserialize_entity(context, entity) def serialize_context(self, context): return context.to_dict() def deserialize_context(self, context): return oslo_context.context.RequestContext.from_dict(context) _SERIALIZER = RequestContextSerializer( oslo_serializer.JsonPayloadSerializer())

commit_message:
Don't convert raw disks to qcow2 during resize/migrate

Change I792e0fb986a6c5cf9ac477cef0949c8a40099faa unconditionally
converts all raw disks to qcow2 if use_cow_images is set to True. This
includes config disks, which are intended to be unconditionally raw.
We weren't noticing this previously, as a subsequent bug meant that
the config disk was unconditionally overwritten with a new, raw one.

The original reason given for doing is adequately handled in
_disk_resize above.

Related-Bug: #1548884
Change-Id: I384a7a7fb989cb8a423c669b9af9cda684771cb5

commit_message:
Correctly configure Spark with Hive, HBase

- Correctly determine where Hive and
  Hbase are installed.
- Add property to hbase-site.xml to
  correctly integrate Hbase with Spark.
- Install mapr-hive and mapr-hbase packages
  on Spark node when Hive and HBase are
  installed on nodes different from Spark.
- Copy hive-site.xml and hbase-site.xml to
  Spark node.

Change-Id: I0087cba69d8d1225c0baa0c7e31fb139aa57cb4a
Closes-Bug: #1560027

commit_message:
Update firewall module version

The package "iptables-persistent" wasn't installed
when facter trying to get version. Update of module has
Facter.flush method call to clear Facter cache.

commit_message:
Add warning about mongodb's bind IP parameter

The mongodb's bind_ip was changed to bindIp as per commit:

https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-mongodb/commit/cb14e9d7920d5b3fe4b8c2341a882fc51bb64c29

This commit adds a warning for when we update mongodb to
version 3.X

Depends-On: I18013aed55ae7a6fc4ec7fc66c38d30cc0df92e1

Change-Id: I54317be1d9b94f3ed78c4f6288d114f39aafcdac

added_lines: mongodb::server::bind_ip: {get_input: mongo_db_network} # WARNING: this parameter will change in mongodb 3.X to bindIP

as of the liberty release, keystone has emitted deprecation warnings
when groups were created without a domain id specified; keystone would
fall back to using the default domain specified in keystone.conf.

as of newton, this fallback is being removed in favor of always
specifying the domain id, and raising an exception if it is not present.

Change-Id: I6004644531c2e86cafe3714451101e6b977a8593

commit_message:
include domain_id when creating groups

as of the liberty release, keystone has emitted deprecation warnings
when groups were created without a domain id specified; keystone would
fall back to using the default domain specified in keystone.conf.

as of newton, this fallback is being removed in favor of always
specifying the domain id, and raising an exception if it is not present.

Change-Id: I6004644531c2e86cafe3714451101e6b977a8593
Needed-By: I0b061c7df45c10b419c0b1474c9217c4402f70fb

commit_message:
Add RadosGW readiness check

After radosgw service start it requires some time to get operational state
This change introduces check script which waits until radosgw start to serve
http requests.

Change-Id: Iaeb3f60c0da114de1fea3f0ec3aa69acd05b037a
Closes-bug: #1545651
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/33/297633/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env ruby require 'hiera' ENV['LANG'] = 'C' $hiera = Hiera.new(:config => '/etc/hiera.yaml') def ready_rgw public_rgw_address = $hiera.lookup('public_vip', nil, {}) public_rgw_port = '8080' stdout = `curl -s -o /dev/null -w "%{http_code}" http://#{public_rgw_address}:#{public_rgw_port}` return true if $?.exitstatus == 0 and stdout == '200' puts "Error: exit code #{$?.exitstatus}, HTTP code #{stdout}" return false end # check if radosgw is ready def wait_for_ready_rgw 60.times do |try| puts "try #{try}" return if ready_rgw sleep 10 end raise "RadosGW is not ready yet!" end wait_for_ready_rgw

commit_message:
Add removal of the /etc/resolv.conf.save file for +bug/1567004

The change at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/302352/ should stop
the if up/down scripts from making changes to resolv.conf as
discussed in that review and the related bug below. However during
upgrades, as we are moving from a version of the ifcfg-vlanXX files
that don't have the PEERDNS=no added by /#/c/302352 the if up
script will restore the /etc/resolv.conf.save to /etc/resolv.conf
and overwrite it. This removes the .save file during the upgrade
init command which gets delivered to all nodes as the first stage
of a major upgrade.

Change-Id: I91dd139f43be4912c20d8661691bee2b662964d4
Related-Bug: 1567004
(cherry picked from commit 706c2fe4b62f95ac13ee800fc08e549180afc810)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/28/303228/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # For the UpgradeInit also rename /etc/resolv.conf.save for +bug/1567004 - "if [[ -f /etc/resolv.conf.save ]] ; then rm /etc/resolv.conf.save; fi\n\n"

commit_message:
Add removal of the /etc/resolv.conf.save file for +bug/1567004

The change at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/302352/ should stop
the if up/down scripts from making changes to resolv.conf as
discussed in that review and the related bug below. However during
upgrades, as we are moving from a version of the ifcfg-vlanXX files
that don't have the PEERDNS=no added by /#/c/302352 the if up
script will restore the /etc/resolv.conf.save to /etc/resolv.conf
and overwrite it. This removes the .save file during the upgrade
init command which gets delivered to all nodes as the first stage
of a major upgrade.

Change-Id: I91dd139f43be4912c20d8661691bee2b662964d4
Related-Bug: 1567004
(cherry picked from commit 706c2fe4b62f95ac13ee800fc08e549180afc810)

commit_message:
Add method is_valid_cidr to netutils

This method exists in Nova[1], Magnum[2] and neutron_client[3],
and can be leveraged by other projects as well.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/13.0.0.0b2/nova/utils.py#L657
[2]https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/1.1.0/magnum/common/utils.py#L256
[3]https://github.com/openstack/python-neutronclient/blob/4.0.0/neutronclient/common/utils.py#L187

Change-Id: Ia9c8c0123e6d1e9f8bd2b662871b4d01f14bd06d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.utils refs/changes/26/287026/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def is_valid_cidr(address): """Check if address is valid The provided address can be a IPv6 or a IPv4 CIDR address. """ try: # Validate the correct CIDR Address netaddr.IPNetwork(address) except netaddr.AddrFormatError: return False # Prior validation partially verify /xx part # Verify it here ip_segment = address.split('/') if (len(ip_segment) <= 1 or ip_segment[1] == ''): return False return True

commit_message:
Add new jobs to openstack/designate-tempest-plugin

Add requirements, tarball, pypi upload jobs for o/designate-tempest-plugin.
We switch to using the python-jobs JJB macro, as more of the jobs are used
than are not used.

Change-Id: Ie3e82fcd0491619a3cc4c9f7fddcca41257770a7

commit_message:
remove complex capabilities for meter, resource and statistics

complex query functionalities for those there APIs are never exist
or plan to do so, leave it in capabilities is misleading to end user,
because they never can be True for any back end storage.

Change-Id: Ie1f640abe4970a0e6ea6fe076961855c9dca66e5
APIImpact: /v2/capabilities response removes some never used fields

commit_message:
Add python-appcatalogclient repository

This commit adds a new repository for the OpenStack client library
for accessing the Community App Catalog from the command line.

Partially-Implements: blueprint openstack-client-plugin
Needed-By: I14f729213f97dd674f269aecbc4fda3d85f8ab45
Change-Id: I55ec9790a283060e0f20a218a593fd7e3467650d

commit_message:
upload both sdist and wheel on pre-release

We used to only upload wheels of pre-release packages to protect folks
who were using old versions of pip from having those things installed
"accidentally". It has been long enough, and we expect everyone to have
upgraded their pip by now, so update the job definitions so that when we
tag a pre-release we upload both the sdist and the wheel.

Change-Id: I7c1563b130ba5640f8d47c8795be64238532f56c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Make sure we run bindep for all puppet-jobs

Now that puppet jobs are off devstack-*, we'll run bindep to ensure
all the required packages are installed.

Change-Id: I8ac599a61f2a9181a974f302195e4f7cd699e490
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: Enable src and non-src tinyipa jobs against Ironic
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-06 13:02:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/a8f3f230b9e208f1b1c3ef00f79f68be383a7e28', 'message': 'Enable src and non-src tinyipa jobs against Ironic

Now that we have a post job against ironic-python-agent that builds and

commit_message:
Enable src and non-src tinyipa jobs against Ironic

Now that we have a post job against ironic-python-agent that builds and
publishes a tinyipa image to tarballs.openstack.org, we can optimise the
the Ironic tinyipa gate by using the pre-built image to speed up the
devstack process. Once the non-src job has proved its success then the
src job will be removed from the Ironic check queue.

Change-Id: I61606b37fa011f2ea91cfe7f391a37daafc4c0e1
Depends-On: I641a5afe8318ec0848395b2b70e056c448f3dd00

commit_message:
Don't use singleton dicts unwittingly

filters={} is dangerous because it creates a singleton re-usable dict
that will collect data over time. The correct python pattern is to pass
None as the parameter and then do if None: set to dict.

Change-Id: I90b233dc2b5dc17cb8180aa5786865c0d98358f5

commit_message:
Adds distro-specific changes to make CI work

- Adds conditional for CentOS/RHEL and Ubuntu/Debian
- Disables gpgcheck for RDO
- Bumps release from liberty to mitaka
- Bumps RDO repo to Testing

Change-Id: I356f110ef0f80a0282e3ebea1fd7dae5ce9246e7
Depends-On: Ic3f27a48ad3ae75a514a0637c2f895ee6e6bfae2
Depends-On: I438fe85a2883029973fa2f5f8b263b7689334c8f
Depends-On: I2dbbafaf8641ece00d4181d1ea4ba93f00eed6ed
Depends-On: Iefe0cd8037c20627d326e0922476f8499b477d77
Depends-On: If8b784baadb761f1e92c9014c595361096384add
Depends-On: Ifb1411a4392d04cd9a5e867ffc95327adf4ea4ea
Depends-On: Icd75ff370f20d77f564bd6eb700704372345b0de
Depends-On: Ie4a742a2a8aaeeec2886fcc0513e654d0237997c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-common refs/changes/21/291921/21 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ## This script is for installing all the needed packages on centos 7 and trusty to run the chef tests with 'chef exec rake' if [ -f /etc/redhat-release ] ; then # install needed packages sudo yum -y groupinstall "Development Tools" sudo yum -y install lzma-devel zlib-devel # install chefdk chefdk=chefdk-0.9.0-1.el7.x86_64.rpm wget -nv -t 3 https://opscode-omnibus-packages.s3.amazonaws.com/el/7/x86_64/$chefdk sudo yum -y install $chefdk rm $chefdk elif [ -f /etc/debian_version ]; then # install needed packages sudo apt-get -y install build-essential liblzma-dev zlib1g-dev # install chefdk chefdk=chefdk_0.9.0-1_amd64.deb wget -nv -t 3 https://opscode-omnibus-packages.s3.amazonaws.com/ubuntu/12.04/x86_64/$chefdk sudo dpkg -i $chefdk rm $chefdk fi
deleted_lines: ## This script is for installing all the needed packages on trusty to run the chef tests with 'chef exec rake' # install needed packages sudo apt-get -y install build-essential liblzma-dev zlib1g-dev # install chefdk chefdk=chefdk_0.9.0-1_amd64.deb wget -nv -t 3 https://opscode-omnibus-packages.s3.amazonaws.com/ubuntu/12.04/x86_64/$chefdk sudo dpkg -i $chefdk rm $chefdk

commit_message:
Update func tests for latest devstack flavors

The most recent devstack adds new flavors to the existing set, so
we need to adjust some functional tests that are testing range
searches across flavors.

Note that we have a gate test that tests against stable/liberty
and that devstack still has the original m1 flavors only. So we
need to account for that in the functional tests.

Change-Id: I98ce866686f3243ef2d2800b872a9840761fbe1a

commit_message:
Use admin user for glance uploads

I think it's more correct to use a normal user, admin,
to upload images, instead of using the service accounts.

Change-Id: Ifb1411a4392d04cd9a5e867ffc95327adf4ea4ea

commit_message:
Define context.roles with base class

In f383bd2973c58c5272504603e4f9dddd55c5bb68, oslo.context (2.2.0)
added roles support in the context itself. This passes roles to
super()__init__.

Updated to_dict() to use base class method first.

Change-Id: Iea73ece42ca21d7ddfa85614b53fb7272cf75a76

commit_message:
Differentiate between Ubuntu and CentOS for integration

Change-Id: I438fe85a2883029973fa2f5f8b263b7689334c8f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-chef-repo refs/changes/39/291939/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'PATH' => ['$PATH:/usr/sbin'], sh %(sudo chef-client #{client_opts} -E allinone-ubuntu14 -r 'recipe[openstack-integration-test::setup]')def _dump_logs paths = [] paths << "-r \"\" /etc/#{project}/*" paths << "-r \"\" /var/log/#{project}/*" _run_commands('Dump Logs', { 'sleep' => ['25'], 'grep' => paths } ) sh %(sudo chef-client #{client_opts} -E allinone-ubuntu14 -r 'role[allinone]') _dump_logs # TODO (MRV) gather logs
deleted_lines: sh %(sudo chef-client #{client_opts} -E allinone-ubuntu14 -r 'recipe[openstack-integration-test::setup]' || true)def _save_logs(prefix) sh %(sleep 25) sh %(mkdir -p logs/#{prefix}/#{project}) sh %(sudo cp -r /etc/#{project} logs/#{prefix}/#{project}/etc) sh %(sudo cp -r /var/log/#{project} logs/#{prefix}/#{project}/log) sh %(sudo chef-client #{client_opts} -E allinone-ubuntu14 -r 'role[allinone]' || true) _save_logs("pass#{i}") sh %(sudo chown -R $USER logs)

commit_message:
Ubuntu mitaka package name changes for openvswitch agent

neutron-openvswitch-agent
Replaces:
  neutron-plugin-ml2 (<< 2:8.0.0~b2-0ubuntu5~)
  neutron-plugin-openvswitch-agent (<< 2:8.0.0~b2-0ubuntu1~)

Change-Id: Icd75ff370f20d77f564bd6eb700704372345b0de
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-network refs/changes/71/302371/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: %w(neutron-openvswitch-agent) 'neutron-openvswitch-agent'

subject: Restart glance immediately
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-07 15:24:35.000000000', 'files': ['recipes/registry.rb', 'spec/api_spec.rb', 'spec/registry_spec.rb', 'recipes/api.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-image/commit/a2ee560a2b7ab263b28c6d848765c4346c03f742', 'message': "Restart glance immediately

Since glance could be used to upload images,
make sure it's restarted immediately within the recipe.

Change-Id: Ie4a742a2a8aaeeec2886fcc0513e654d0237997c
"}]
commit_message:
Restart glance immediately

Since glance could be used to upload images,
make sure it's restarted immediately within the recipe.

Change-Id: Ie4a742a2a8aaeeec2886fcc0513e654d0237997c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-image refs/changes/66/302866/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ], :immediately

commit_message:
Adds migration step from nova to nova_api database

This patch adds a missing required step to migrate information from the nova
to the new nova_api database.

Closes-Bug: #1565497

Change-Id: Ia1554e12c688e5a6509af2d37f1825fd4ab666be
Co-Authored-By: Steven Dake <stdake@cisco.com>
(cherry picked from commit 7676b079e6b812b16ac63d753d27853e75732d69)

commit_message:
Increase timeout of WaitCondition due to ConcurrentTransactions

Currently we have retry logic with random period of delay.
There is a chance, when we have several re-try attemts with maximum
timeout, so it can be a root cause of floating fails, when we have not
enough time for getting all signals.

Also decrease number of signals from 30 to 25, due to small risk, when
one of signals goes to ConcurrentTransaction error.

Note, that all these changes are made in corresponding functional test
and don't affect main code.

Change-Id: I9ca85c4378d0f62e316f4f40ff73597ffaaabadf
Related-Bug: #1497274

commit_message:
Fix Hue integration with Spark and Hive

- When Spark and Hue are installed on different nodes
  hue-livy must be installed on the Spark node.
- Change permissions for hue-livy directory.
- Connect to hive server address instead of metastore.

Closes-Bug: #1560118
Change-Id: Ie036b10d776e24c2feb45039bff81853a39373ec
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/23/297323/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: vu.on_same_node(HUE_LIVY, spark.SPARK_SLAVE), hive_host = context.get_instance(hive.HIVE_SERVER_2) if hive_host: hive_service = context.get_service(hive.HIVE_SERVER_2) hue_livy_instance = cluster_context.get_instance(HUE_LIVY) if hue_livy_instance: with hue_livy_instance.remote() as r: LOG.debug("Changing Hue home dir owner") set_owner(r)
deleted_lines: hive_host = context.get_instance(hive.HIVE_METASTORE) if hive_host: hive_service = context.get_service(hive.HIVE_METASTORE)

" "POLL_TEMP_URL crear y cumplimentar un TempURL de Swift con metadatos para " "sondeo. commit_message:
Add experimental bindep JJB for kolla

We cannot update the current template without affecting kolla jobs, so
create an experimental one we can use for testing purposes.

Change-Id: Id24226bd88e39ccb0f67b4750504e81b0527f450
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/09/302909/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - gate-kolla-bindep-build-centos-7-binary - gate-kolla-bindep-build-centos-7-source

The _detach_pci_devices gets pci_devs which is list
of PciDevice objects. The code that check if pci is
detach is using dev['address'] and as not in the obj

commit_message:
libvirt: pci detach devices should use dev.address

The _detach_pci_devices gets pci_devs which is list
of PciDevice objects. The code that check if pci is
detach is using dev['address'] and as not in the obj
format dev.address.

Closes-Bug: #1565466

Change-Id: I9ba58707d03d19018a025d7760f2a77f84d23aad
(cherry picked from commit 871368bc65eb9ededd053055c35673dbb61dd3ad)

commit_message:
[sahara] setup additional jobs for sahara-dashboard

adding new jobs for sahara-dashboard testing:

 * unit tests with python34
 * unit tests with django 1.9 and python27.

commit_message:
Define context.roles with base class

In f383bd2973c58c5272504603e4f9dddd55c5bb68, oslo.context (2.2.0)
added roles support in the context itself. This passes roles to
super()__init__.

Cleanup of to_dict() to construct initially with base class.

Change-Id: I688eed81bfeddd9455121ac0ce1b6903bf8d5e87
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/43/302343/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: request_id=request_id) self.roles = roles return { 'auth_token': self.auth_token, 'project_name': self.tenant_name, 'is_admin': self.is_admin, 'roles': self.roles, 'resource_uuid': self.resource_uuid, 'request_id': self.request_id, }

commit_message:
Change property for auto creating schema

Change old property datanucleus.autoCreateSchema
to datanucleus.schema.autoCreateAll for all
supported hives.

Change-Id: Ib96b5f601b78ada4677595fcdac2aa0041272e93
Closes-Bug: #1566311

commit_message:
SPI Method to Validate Images

Adds SPI method and utility module to Sahara. Does not yet include any
yaml files or plugin implementations in this change set; early
implementations are in the works for testing but not yet ready for
review, and will come in separate commits for modularity.

Partially-implements: blueprint validate-image-spi
Change-Id: I9f59219a801325176a70fd8da1ca3b38efc5b109

subject: Add openstack/monasca-transform project
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-02 14:38:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/5c35f345fca948e93b16be1e29b4401de1b83498', 'message': 'Add openstack/monasca-transform project

Change-Id: I7826768e174a229bc184ea38d75d212ac957e26c
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-02 14:56:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/405ca40a785877b67b2ede24fd4e58031c48d50e', 'message': 'Add openstack/monasca-transform project

The monasca-transform project is a new component in Monasca that
will aggregate and transform metrics. For example, it will consume
metrics for Swift from the Monasca metrics topic to count the total
number of times a container or object is accessed and group by
project. Then it will publish the aggregated metric to the Kafka
metric topic where the rest of the existing Monasca components will
be used to store, alarm and notify.

Change-Id: I7826768e174a229bc184ea38d75d212ac957e26c
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-02 14:58:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/e6668bed300e2fa5829eef49eed0cf3fbd3c47c9', 'message': 'Add openstack/monasca-transform project

The monasca-transform project is a new component in Monasca that
will aggregate and transform metrics. For example, it will consume
metrics for Swift from the Monasca metrics topic and count the total
number of times a container or object is accessed and group them by
project. Then it will publish the aggregated metric to the Kafka
metrics topic where the rest of the existing Monasca components
will be used to store, alarm and notify.

Change-Id: I7826768e174a229bc184ea38d75d212ac957e26c
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-04-02 15:35:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/e96d963e8d81da337355b143a79fadd2d5c299da', 'message': 'Add openstack/monasca-transform project

The monasca-transform project is a new component in Monasca that
will aggregate and transform metrics. For example, it will consume
metrics for Swift from the Monasca metrics topic and count the total
number of times a container or object is accessed and group them by
project. Then it will publish the aggregated metric to the Kafka
metrics topic where the rest of the existing Monasca components

commit_message:
Add openstack/monasca-transform project

The monasca-transform project is a new component in Monasca that
will aggregate and transform metrics. For example, it will consume
metrics for Swift from the Monasca metrics topic and count the total
number of times a container or object is accessed and group them by
project. Then it will publish the aggregated metric to the Kafka
metrics topic where the rest of the existing Monasca components
will be used to store, alarm and notify.

Change-Id: I7826768e174a229bc184ea38d75d212ac957e26c
Needed-By: I9227a6afb468e05aaeb939930b872d1c64f79551

commit_message:
Overwrite Usage class's get() function

base.Resource's get function will call its manager's get() function
with one parameter. However UsageManager's get function takes three
parameters.

Change-Id: I958a55c4d52cec4d1177371b788b3cf788098a6c
Closes-bug: 1552616
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/35/287735/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import oslo_utils def get(self): fmt = '%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S.%f' if self.start and self.stop and self.tenant_id: # set_loaded() first ... so if we have to bail, we know we tried. self.set_loaded(True) start = oslo_utils.timeutils.parse_strtime(self.start, fmt=fmt) stop = oslo_utils.timeutils.parse_strtime(self.stop, fmt=fmt) new = self.manager.get(self.tenant_id, start, stop) if new: self._add_details(new._info) self.append_request_ids(new.request_ids) else: pass

added_lines: "PO-Revision-Date: 2016-04-08 05:41+0000\n""All InfiniBand networks must have a subnet manager running for the network " "to function. This is true even when doing a simple network of two machines " "with no switch and the cards are plugged in back-to-back. A subnet manager " "is required for the link on the cards to come up. It is possible to have " "more than one subnet manager. In this case, one of them will act as the " "master, and any other will act as a slave that will take over when the " "master subnet manager fails." msgstr "" " InfiniBand " " 2 " "" "" " 1 " "" "" msgid """However, load balancers deployed onto private or isolated networks need a " "floating IP address assigned if they must be accessible to external clients. " "To complete this step, you must have a router between the private and public " "networks and an available floating IP address." msgstr "" "" " Floating IP " " Floating IP " " " "Floating IP " msgid """In this example, the health monitor removes the server from the pool if it " "fails a health check at two five-second intervals. When the server recovers " "and begins responding to health checks again, it is added to the pool once " "again." msgstr "" " 5  2 " "" "" msgid "" "In this example, the load balancer uses the round robin algorithm and the " "traffic alternates between the web servers on the backend." msgstr "" "" "" msgid ""msgid "" "Linux distributions often package older releases of Open vSwitch that can " "introduce issues during operation with the Networking service. We recommend " "using at least the latest long-term stable (LTS) release of Open vSwitch for " "the best experience and support from Open vSwitch. See `<http://www." "openvswitch.org>`__ for available releases and the `installation " "instructions <https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/blob/master/INSTALL.md>`__ " "for building newer releases from source on various distributions." msgstr "" "Linux  Open vSwitch " " Networking " " Open vSwitch " " LTS ()  Open vSwitch " " `<http://www.openvswitch.org>`__ " "" " ` <https://github.com/openvswitch/" "ovs/blob/master/INSTALL.md>` " msgid "" "Load balancers that are deployed on a public or provider network that are " "accessible to external clients do not need a floating IP address assigned. " "External clients can directly access the virtual IP address (VIP) of those " "load balancers." msgstr "" "" " Floating IP " " IP  (VIP) " "" msgid "" "Quotas are available for limiting the number of load balancers and load " "balancer pools. By default, both quotas are set to 10." msgstr "" "" " 10 " "Start by creating a listener, attaching a pool, and then adding members:" msgstr "" msgid """The LBaaS v2 agent collects four types of statistics for each load balancer " "every six seconds. Users can query these statistics with the :command:`lbaas-" "loadbalancer-stats` command:" msgstr "" "LBaaS v2  6  4 " " :command:`lbaas-loadbalancer-" "stats` " msgid ""msgid "" "The ``active_connections`` count is the total number of connections that " "were active at the time the agent polled the load balancer. The other three " "statistics are cumulative since the load balancer was last started. For " "example, if the load balancer restarts due to a system error or a " "configuration change, these statistics will be reset." msgstr "" "``active_connections`` " " 3 " "" "" msgid "" "The ``service_plugins`` option contains no value because the Networking " "service does not provide layer-3 services such as routing. However, this " "breaks portions of the dashboard that manage the Networking service. See the " "`Installation Guide <http://docs.openstack.org/liberty/install-guide-ubuntu/" "horizon-install.html>`__ for more information." msgstr "" " Networking  3 " " ``service_plugins`` " " Networking " " ` <http://docs.openstack.org/" "liberty/ja/install-guide-ubuntu/horizon-install.html>`__ " msgid "The load balancer now handles traffic on ports 80 and 443." msgstr "" " 80  443 " "The support for SR-IOV with InfiniBand allows a Virtual PCI device (VF) to " "be directly mapped to the guest, allowing higher performance and advanced " "features such as RDMA (remote direct memory access). To use this feature, " "you must:" msgstr "" "InfiniBand  SR-IOV   PCI  (VF) " " RDMA (remote direct memory access) " "" msgid """To further simplify this scenario, we recommend using a configuration drive " "rather than the conventional metadata agent to provide instance metadata." msgstr "" "" "" "" msgid """With the load balancer online, you can add a listener for plaintext HTTP " "traffic on port 80:" msgstr "" " HTTP  80 " "" msgid ""msgid "" "You can add a health monitor so that unresponsive servers are removed from " "the pool:" msgstr "" "" "" msgid "" "You can add another listener on port 443 for HTTPS traffic. LBaaS v2 offers " "SSL/TLS termination at the load balancer, but this example takes a simpler " "approach and allows encrypted connections to terminate at each member server." msgstr "" "HTTPS  443  LBaaS " "v2  SSL/TLS " "" msgid "You can also add a health monitor for the HTTPS pool:" msgstr "HTTPS " "You can begin building a pool and adding members to the pool to serve HTTP " "content on port 80. For this example, the web servers are ``192.168.1.16`` " "and ``192.168.1.17``:" msgstr "" " 80  HTTP " " ``192.168.1.16``  ``192.168.1.17`` " msgid """You can use ``curl`` to verify connectivity through the load balancers to " "your web servers:" msgstr "" "``curl`` " "" msgid "" "You can use the ``lbaas-loadbalancer-show`` command from the beginning of " "this section to locate the ``vip_port_id``. The ``vip_port_id`` is the ID of " "the network port that is assigned to the load balancer. You can associate a " "free floating IP address to the load balancer using ``floatingip-associate``:" msgstr "" " ``lbaas-loadbalancer-show``  " "``vip_port_id``  ``vip_port_id`` " " ID  ``floatingip-associate``  " "Floating IP " msgid ""

subject: Add Windows as supported operating system
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-07 16:26:41.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_requirements/cmds/edit_constraint.py', 'openstack_requirements/project.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/d222730d2ec062b9d438d6a98c4ddddba5622506', 'message': 'Add Windows as supported operating system

This change is necessary in order to use the project's
update-requirements.py script when preparing the environment on the
Hyper-V compute nodes used in the Hyper-V CI. Using the mentioned script
will set the latest requirements in nova, neutron, manila, etc.,
reducing the CI's amount of failures caused by outdated requirements.

Including Microsoft Windows as a supported operating system on this
project. Also, we update the edit-constraints.py and project.py
files to support os.rename() of Windows.

On Windows, os.rename() will create a file with the source
name, without deleting the initial file first.

Example of a traceback:

 Traceback (most recent call last):
   File "C:\Python27\Scripts\edit-constraints-script.py", line 9, in
 <module>
     load_entry_point('openstack.requirements==0.0.1.dev2497',
 'console_scripts', 'edit-constraints')()
   File
 "C:\Python27\lib\site-packages\openstack_requirements\cmds\edit_constraint.py",
 line 74, in main
     os.rename(args[0] + '.tmp', args[0])
 WindowsError: [Error 183] Cannot create a file when that file already exists

This could be easily solved by removing the file before the rename.

Proposed fix:
Add before "os.rename(args[0] + '.tmp', args[0])" the line "os.remove(args[0])"
in edit_constraint.py
Add before "os.rename(tmpname, fullname)" the line "os.remove(fullname)"
in project.py
Add "Operating System :: Microsoft :: Windows" in setup.cfg

DocImpact: Added Windows as a supported OS in setup.cfg
Change-Id: If123a65fd8d49d5c67a1db16827a9617ce520dba
Signed-off-by: Costin Galan <cgalan@cloudbasesolutions.com>
(cherry picked from commit 7bca31945156f9d411b3dc8e11b93dfd2a63448d)
'}]
commit_message:
Add Windows as supported operating system

This change is necessary in order to use the project's
update-requirements.py script when preparing the environment on the
Hyper-V compute nodes used in the Hyper-V CI. Using the mentioned script
will set the latest requirements in nova, neutron, manila, etc.,
reducing the CI's amount of failures caused by outdated requirements.

Including Microsoft Windows as a supported operating system on this
project. Also, we update the edit-constraints.py and project.py
files to support os.rename() of Windows.

On Windows, os.rename() will create a file with the source
name, without deleting the initial file first.

Example of a traceback:

 Traceback (most recent call last):
   File "C:\Python27\Scripts\edit-constraints-script.py", line 9, in
 <module>
     load_entry_point('openstack.requirements==0.0.1.dev2497',
 'console_scripts', 'edit-constraints')()
   File
 "C:\Python27\lib\site-packages\openstack_requirements\cmds\edit_constraint.py",
 line 74, in main
     os.rename(args[0] + '.tmp', args[0])
 WindowsError: [Error 183] Cannot create a file when that file already exists

This could be easily solved by removing the file before the rename.

Proposed fix:
Add before "os.rename(args[0] + '.tmp', args[0])" the line "os.remove(args[0])"
in edit_constraint.py
Add before "os.rename(tmpname, fullname)" the line "os.remove(fullname)"
in project.py
Add "Operating System :: Microsoft :: Windows" in setup.cfg

DocImpact: Added Windows as a supported OS in setup.cfg
Change-Id: If123a65fd8d49d5c67a1db16827a9617ce520dba
Signed-off-by: Costin Galan <cgalan@cloudbasesolutions.com>
(cherry picked from commit 7bca31945156f9d411b3dc8e11b93dfd2a63448d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/39/302939/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Operating System :: Microsoft :: Windows
